title: Easy Ways to Inspect Element on Mac in Different Web Browsers

steps.title: Open Preferences or Settings in Safari.
steps.content: Open Preferences or Settings in Safari. Once you launch Safari (the app icon looks like a blue compass with a red and white needle), click Safari in the Apple menu and choose Preferences or Settings , depending on your version of macOS. You first have to enable the "Inspect Element" tool before you can use it in Safari.

steps.title: Click the Advanced tab.
steps.content: Click the Advanced tab. It's to the far right of the window with gear icons.

steps.title: Click to check the box next to "Show Develop menu in menu bar" .
steps.content: Click to check the box next to "Show Develop menu in menu bar" . Once the box shows a checkmark, you're able to continue to the next step! If this box is already checked, don't uncheck it.

steps.title: Inspect a page.
steps.content: Inspect a page. Go to a page with an element you want to inspect, then inspect it three ways: Go to Develop > Show Web Inspector OR Right-click or ctrl-click the page and click Inspect Element from the drop-down menu OR Press Cmd + Opt + I on your keyboard. [1] X Research source To close this window, click the X in the top left corner of the toolbar.

steps.title: Launch Chrome.
steps.content: Launch Chrome. Click the multicolored orb icon to launch Chrome.

steps.title: Navigate to the site you want to inspect.
steps.content: Navigate to the site you want to inspect. Use the address bar to go to the page with elements that you want to look at.

steps.title: Inspect the page.
steps.content: Inspect the page. You can do this in a few different ways: Right-click or ctrl-click the page and select Inspect OR Press Cmd + Opt + C . When you're done, close the Web Inspector window by clicking the small X in the toolbar. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Open Firefox.
steps.content: Open Firefox. Click the icon that looks like a fox encircling a purple-blue ball.

steps.title: Navigate to the site you want to inspect.
steps.content: Navigate to the site you want to inspect. Go to the page with elements on it that you'd like to look at.

steps.title: Inspect the page.
steps.content: Inspect the page. You can do this in a few different ways: Right-click or ctrl-click the page and select Inspect OR Press Cmd + Opt + I . When you're done, close the Web Inspector window by clicking the small X in the toolbar or press Cmd + Opt + I again. [3] X Research source
